title: 111_s1498
content: The Act is titled the "Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2009" and pertains to Federal-Aid Highways. The Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2009 incorporates provisions from previous acts related to transportation until March 31, 2011. Authorization of appropriations is provided for fiscal year 2010. The Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2009 authorizes funds for transportation activities for fiscal year 2009 and fiscal year 2010. Funds authorized for transportation activities in fiscal year 2011 will be distributed and made available in the same manner as previous years. Funds authorized for transportation activities in fiscal year 2011 will be distributed in the same manner as previous years, with \1/2\ of the total amount authorized for fiscal year 2009 allocated for programs under the SAFETEA-LU Technical Corrections Act and title 23, United States Code. Rescissions or cancellations of funds for fiscal year 2009 will not affect the calculation of amounts authorized. Funds authorized under this section will be administered similarly to funds apportioned under title 23, United States Code, with exceptions for certain obligations under section 125 of title 23. Funds authorized under this section will be subject to limitations on obligations for fiscal years 2010 and 2011 as specified in the Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act. The Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act sets limitations on funds for fiscal years 2010 and 2011. For fiscal year 2010, there is flexibility in the allocation of funds to states. The Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act determines the allocation of funds to states for various programs under title 23, United States Code, based on the amounts received in fiscal year 2009. The Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act allocates funds to states for programs under title 23, United States Code based on fiscal year 2009 amounts. The Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act allocates funds to states for programs under title 23, United States Code based on fiscal year 2009 amounts, in the same proportion for each program and with the same administration as under such sections. No additional funds shall be provided. The Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act allocates funds to states for programs under title 23, United States Code based on fiscal year 2009 amounts. No additional funds shall be provided for projects already sufficiently funded before or during fiscal year 2009. Funds for such projects will be reserved and redistributed to each State accordingly. Extension of authorizations under Title V of SAFETEA-LU allows funds allocated to states for highway projects in fiscal year 2009 to be redistributed based on the proportion of funds available in each state compared to the total funds available nationwide. The programs authorized under Title V of SAFETEA-LU will be extended for fiscal year 2010 at the same funding levels as 2009, and at half the levels for the period from October 1, 2010, to March 31, 2011. Funds will be distributed to major program areas in the same proportions as in 2009. No additional funds will be provided for projects or activities under Title V of SAFETEA-LU if the Secretary of Transportation determines they were adequately funded in fiscal year 2009. Any funds that would have been allocated for a project but are prohibited from being used will be redistributed to other program areas. Funds authorized under this subsection shall be distributed according to paragraph (2) but subject to limitations on obligations for fiscal years 2010 and 2011. Limitation on obligations for fiscal year 2009 under section 5102 of the Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act: A Legacy for Users (119 Stat. 1780). SEC. 3. ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES. Authorization of Contract Authority: Funds are authorized to be appropriated from the Highway Trust Fund for administrative expenses of the Federal-aid highway program. This includes $422,425,000 for fiscal year 2010 and $217,023,500 for the period from October 1, 2010, to March 31, 2011. These funds are available for obligation and administered similarly to apportioned funds under title 23, United States Code, with a limitation on obligations for Federal-aid highways and highway safety construction programs. The funds remain available until expended. The funds shall remain available until expended.
